summary: This is a formal U.S. Department of Justice request to Swedish authorities for assistance in interviewing a witness in Sweden as part of the ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and his associates. The witness, a Swedish citizen, is not a target and has agreed to a voluntary interview. The document outlines the legal basis for the investigation and requests confidentiality.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a U.S. citizen alleged to have engaged in the sexual abuse of minor girls from approximately 1995 through 2005. He was charged with sex trafficking in July 2019 and committed suicide in August 2019 while awaiting trial.

events.title: Period of Epstein's Alleged Abuse
events.description: The timeframe during which Jeffrey Epstein is alleged to have engaged in the sexual abuse of minor girls.

events.title: Epstein Charged with Sex Trafficking
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was charged with sex trafficking of minors in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide while awaiting trial.

events.title: Planned Witness Interview
events.description: A witness in Sweden has indicated willingness to consent to a voluntary interview on this date.

keyFacts: The U.S. is investigating certain individuals (Epstein's associates) for offenses implicating sexual misconduct with minors.
A witness living in Sweden may have observed events, conduct, or conversations relevant to the investigation and has agreed to a voluntary interview.
The witness is explicitly stated not to be a target or subject of the investigation and is not believed to have committed any crime.
The investigation is continuing into possible criminal actions by certain of Jeffrey Epstein's associates.
One of Epstein's victims has alleged misconduct involving one or more of Epstein's associates and stated the Swedish witness observed some of the victim's interactions.
